metadata.Name: RuBLiMP
metadata.Description: A benchmark for evaluating Russian language models on their linguistic knowledge. It consists of minimal pairs of sentences, one grammatically correct and one incorrect, covering diverse morphosyntactic phenomena.
Provider: Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Paper Title: RuBLiMP: Russian Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs
Affiliations: Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Abstract: We present RuBLiMP, a new benchmark for evaluating Russian language models on their linguistic knowledge. The benchmark is created semi-automatically based on manually crafted grammar templates and consists of minimal pairs of sentences. Each pair illustrates a particular linguistic phenomenon and contains one grammatically correct and one incorrect sentence. The resulting dataset contains over 120k minimal pairs covering a diverse set of morphosyntactic phenomena, such as subject-verb agreement, case marking, and semantic constraints. We use RuBLiMP to evaluate a number of popular pretrained Russian language models. Our results demonstrate that while the models show impressive performance on some phenomena, they still struggle with more complex syntactic structures, such as long-distance dependencies. The dataset is publicly available on GitHub: https://github.com/RussianNLP/RuBLiMP.
